item.value: This is the base layout for your project, and will be used on every page unless specified.

These styles are applied to a <meta> tag, which is read by the Foundation JavaScript

Example of selectively including files
this will include every plugin and utility required by Foundation
Compressed CSS with right-to-left reading direction

Know that they all require `foundation.core.js` to be loaded *first*. Some plugins also require specific utility libraries that ship with Foundation—refer to a plugin's documentation to find out which plugins require what, and see the [JavaScript Utilities](javascript-utilities.html) page for more information.
You can import in your HTML the complete Foundation library `foundation.min.js` like above, but also each plugin individually.
Import in HTML
Once you have the files, add links to jQuery and Foundation as `<script>` tags at the bottom of your page, just before the closing `<body>` tag.
You can get the Foundation JavaScript files from a ZIP download, package manager, or CDN. Check out the [Installation](installation.html) page to learn more.
Foundation JavaScript files from a ZIP download, package manager, or CDN. Check out the [Installation](installation.html) page to learn more.
Our JavaScript is easy to set up and only requires jQuery to get going.

Correct the font size and margin on `h1` elements within `section` and

Is a keyword preventing the usage of the inflation algorithm on the element. Basically, this means that the element will be displayed without its font inflated. On desktop Webkit-based browsers, this will only prevent any zoom on the whole page.
- webkit - text - size - adjust
Remove the margin in all browsers.
